definitions: the action of attempting to explain or justify behavior or an attitude with logical reasons, even if these are not appropriate

examples.text: most people are prone to self-deceptive rationalization
they justify themselves with ingenious rationalizations

shortDefinitions: action of attempting to explain or justify behaviour or attitude with logical reasons

definitions: the action of making a company, process, or industry more efficient, especially by dispensing with superfluous personnel or equipment

examples.text: the London dockers struggle to preserve their jobs against ruthless rationalization

shortDefinitions: action of making company, process, or industry more efficient

definitions: the action of reorganizing a process or system so as to make it more logical and consistent
shortDefinitions: action of reorganizing process or system so as to make it more logical and consistent

definitions: the process of converting a function or expression to a rational form.
shortDefinitions: process of converting function or expression to rational form
